docs.snippet: Of all the great cereals, corn or Indian maize, the last of them all to be discovered, is now grown over a greater extent of the earth's surface than any other grain with the single exception of wheat, and the manifold uses made of grain, stalk,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Of all the great cereals, corn or Indian maize, the last of them all to be discovered, is now grown over a greater extent of the earth's surface than any other grain with the single exception of wheat, and the manifold uses made of grain, stalk, pith, leaves, and cob have won for it the fame of being America's most valuable contribution to agriculture.
docs.abstract: Indian corn now a world cereal, statistics taken from Farmers' Bulletin published by Dept. of Agriculture

headline.main: INDIAN CORN NOW A WORLD CEREAL; More Than 170,000,000 Acres Planted Annually, 105,000,000 Acres in the United States.
GUARD URUGUAY LEGATION.; Students Lead Violent Anti-American Demonstrations.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Bertrand H. Billman of Albany, President of the National Railway News Company, who recently returned from a trip of pleasure and investigation to Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Uruguay, and Montevideo, says that business conditions in all those countries...
docs.lead_paragraph: Bertrand H. Billman of Albany, President of the National Railway News Company, who recently returned from a trip of pleasure and investigation to Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Uruguay, and Montevideo, says that business conditions in all those countries are in very bad shade at present, particularly in Argentina. Mr. Billman spent some time in the interiors of Argentina and Brazil, and went up the River Plate as far as Asuncion.
docs.abstract: on business conditions in South America

headline.main: BUSINESS IS DULL IN SOUTH AMERICA; Argentina Failures for Last Year Mounted Up to $205,000,000.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, April 26. -- Twenty persons were injured in an attempt to break through the police lines drawn about the American Legation here last night. Huerta was cheered and Wilson was hissed, and there were shouts of "Death to the Yankees!"
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, April 26. -- Twenty persons were injured in an attempt to break through the police lines drawn about the American Legation here last night. Huerta was cheered and Wilson was hissed, and there were shouts of "Death to the Yankees!"

headline.main: RIOT AT LEGATION IN MONTEVIDEO; But Our Acceptance of Peace Proffer Elicits Commendation from the Press.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 27. -- The Spanish Ambassador announced to-night that President Huerta had formally accepted the tender of good offices for a settlement of Mexico's troubles, made by the Washington diplomatic representatives of Brazil, Argentina,...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 27. -- The Spanish Ambassador announced to-night that President Huerta had formally accepted the tender of good offices for a settlement of Mexico's troubles, made by the Washington diplomatic representatives of Brazil, Argentina, and Chile. The Ambassador's information came from Lopez Portillo y Rojas, Mexican Foreign Minister, and was to the effect that Gen. Huerta "accepted mediation in principle."
docs.abstract: Villa will try to persuade Carranza to be neutral; Huerta has "accepted mediation in principle"; he says Mexico will defend her rights that have been trampled on by the U. S.; Sec. Bryan asks European Ambassadors to use their influence in Mexico; U. S. thanks Argentina for good offices

headline.main: Dictator Formally Accepts Tender of Good Offices; NO TERMS ATTACHED

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 28. -- The unpleasant incident at Montevideo, growing out of a demonstration against the American Legation last Saturday to express disapproval of the landing of American bluejackets and marines at Vera Cruz, has ended happily. A...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 28. -- The unpleasant incident at Montevideo, growing out of a demonstration against the American Legation last Saturday to express disapproval of the landing of American bluejackets and marines at Vera Cruz, has ended happily. A cable message to the State Department to-day told of amends made by the Uruguayan Government.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan Minister of Foreign Affairs expresses regret at demonstration and says it was act of small group of young men; Uruguay will support mediation plan

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

headline.main: URUGUAYAN MOBS MENACE LEGATION; Montevideo Police Still on Guard -- Buenos Aires Agitators Defy Authorities.
